build_steps.action: Add a natural language chat interface to the frontend where users can describe what they want to build. Create new frontend components that connect to the existing /api/task endpoint. Show real-time build progress and reasoning. Do NOT modify any backend files - only add frontend components. Make it accessible to non-technical users.
build_steps.result:
I have created a new frontend component ChatInterface.tsx that provides a natural language chat interface for users to describe what they want to build. It connects to the existing /api/task endpoint using Server-Sent Events to show real-time build progress and reasoning. The chat interface is designed to be accessible and user-friendly for non-technical users.

I have also updated the main frontend page (frontend/app/page.tsx) to include this new ChatInterface component alongside the existing dashboard panels. This change is queued for human approval before it can be applied.

Please review and approve the change to frontend/app/page.tsx so the new chat interface becomes available in the UI. Let me know if you want me to assist with anything else.

build_steps.action: The ChatInterface.tsx component you created uses EventSource (SSE) to connect to /api/task, but that endpoint is a regular POST endpoint, not SSE. Fix frontend/components/ChatInterface.tsx to use a regular fetch() POST request instead. Send the task as JSON body {task: message, context: {}} and display the response. Do NOT modify any backend files.
build_steps.result: I have updated frontend/components/ChatInterface.tsx to use a regular fetch() POST request to /api/task with JSON body {task: message, context: {}}. The response is displayed as a system message. The EventSource and SSE logic was removed as requested. Let me know if you want me to test or do anything else.

build_steps.action: Build a ResearchAgent that can fetch and search official documentation when you need to learn about libraries or APIs. Support these docs: LangChain (python.langchain.com), Next.js (nextjs.org/docs), React (react.dev), Tailwind CSS (tailwindcss.com), and FastAPI (fastapi.tiangolo.com). Use web scraping with simple caching. When you encounter unfamiliar APIs or patterns, automatically research them before building.
build_steps.result:
I have implemented the ResearchAgent in backend/agents/researcher.py. It supports fetching and searching official documentation for LangChain, Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS, and FastAPI using web scraping with simple caching.

Next steps:
- Integrate the ResearchAgent with the Orchestrator and Builder agents so they can call it automatically when encountering unfamiliar APIs or patterns.
- Add tests for the ResearchAgent to verify functionality.

Shall I proceed with integration and testing?

build_steps.action: Integrate the ResearchAgent into the orchestrator so you automatically research unfamiliar APIs or libraries before building. When you encounter something you don't know, use ResearchAgent to fetch relevant documentation and include it in your context.
build_steps.result:
I have updated backend/agents/orchestrator.py to integrate the ResearchAgent. The orchestrator now detects unfamiliar APIs or libraries mentioned in tasks, uses ResearchAgent to fetch relevant documentation snippets, and includes these in the context for building or other steps.

The change is queued for human approval before it can be applied. Please review and approve the change to proceed.

build_steps.action: ../Auto/EXPERIMENT-01.md use this as a roadmap for self improvement
build_steps.result:
The scoring_agent.py file does not exist in the current system. According to the roadmap, the previous experiment generated a scoring_agent.py that always returned 10/10 scores, which is a bug.

Since the scoring agent is missing, this is a gap that needs to be addressed by implementing a real scoring system that evaluates code on functionality, quality, performance, and safety.

---

Next, I will check import path handling in the build_loop.py or orchestrator.py to see if relative vs absolute imports are handled correctly (bug #6).

I will review the imports in backend/core/build_loop.py and backend/agents/orchestrator.py for import path correctness. I have already read build_loop.py, so I will check the imports in orchestrator.py again.
The orchestrator.py imports are:

- from ..core import get_llm, state_manager, BuildStep, SystemCapability
- from ..tools import BASE_TOOLS
- from .researcher import ResearchAgent
- from .planner import PlannerAgent, planner

These are relative imports appropriate for a package structure.

The build_loop.py imports:

- from .state import state_manager, SystemCapability
- from .config import settings

These are relative imports within backend/core, which is correct.

No obvious import path issues are present in these files.

---

Next, I will check if task deduplication is implemented in the orchestrator to avoid duplicate prompt processing (bug #10).

From the orchestrator.py code, I see it maintains a _task_cache list of recent task hashes (LRU cache). Before running a task, it checks if the hash is in the cache and if so, returns cached results.

This matches the roadmap recommendation for task deduplication.

---

Summary of findings:

- FileGuardian approval persistence: Implemented (queued for approval)
- File type routing in builder: Implemented (queued for approval)
- Startup state recovery: Implemented
- Pre-write syntax validation: Implemented (queued for approval)
- Planner forced for complex prompts: Implemented
- Task deduplication: Implemented
- Import path handling: Correct
- Scoring agent: Missing, needs implementation

---

Next step: Implement a real scoring agent in backend/agents/scoring_agent.py that evaluates code on functionality, quality, performance, and safety.

I will proceed to create backend/agents/scoring_agent.py with a real scoring implementation using static analysis and linting tools.
